byline.contributor: Javier C. Hernández reported from Beijing and Michelle Innis from Sydney, Australia. Neil Gough contributed reporting from Hong Kong. Owen Guo contributed research from Beijing.
byline.original: By JAVIER C. HERNÁNDEZ and MICHELLE INNIS

abstract: China's detention of 18 Crown Resorts employees as part of crackdown on gambling is raising concerns government is pursuing strict punishments against foreign casino operators and increasing pressure on industry; inquiry seems focused on Crown's attempts to encourage Chinese businessmen to visit its casinos in Australia.
lead_paragraph: The detention of 18 employees of the Australian chain is raising fears that the Chinese government is seeking harsh punishments against overseas operators.
snippet: The detention of 18 employees of the Australian chain is raising fears that the Chinese government is seeking harsh punishments against overseas operators....

headline.main: China’s Crackdown on Crown Resorts Shakes Casino Industry
headline.print_headline: Detentions by Chinese Put Casinos in Tight Spot
